intro: Lappula alaica, commonly known as the Alpine lappula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent leaves. The plant thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize new areas effectively. Lappula alaica plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is of interest to botanists studying plant resilience.
